tidy.outliers 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Calculate the Mahalanobis outlier "probability"

Source: R/maha.R
step_outliers_maha.Rd

step_outliers_maha creates a specification of a recipe step that will calculate the probability of the row of selected columns being an outliers using maha from OutlierDetection.

step_outliers_maha(
  recipe,
  ...,
  role = NA,
  trained = FALSE,
  outlier_probability = NULL,
  name_mutate = ".outliers_maha",
  options = list(cutoff = 0, rnames = FALSE),
  skip = TRUE,
  id = rand_id("outliers_maha")
)

# S3 method for step_outliers_maha
tidy(x, ...)

Arguments

recipe

A recipe object. The step will be added to the sequence of operations for this recipe.
...

One or more selector functions to choose which variables will be transformed. See selections() for more details. For the tidy method, these are not currently used.
role

not defined for this function
trained

A logical to indicate if the quantities for preprocessing have been estimated.
outlier_probability

a placeholder for the exit of this function don't change
name_mutate

the name of the generated column with maha probabilities
options

a list with cutoff point which is ignored and the rnames argument of the maha function
skip

A logical. Should the step be skipped when the recipe is baked by bake.recipe()? While all operations are baked when prep.recipe() is run, some operations may not be able to be conducted on new data (e.g. processing the outcome variable(s)). Care should be taken when using skip = TRUE as it may affect the computations for subsequent operations
id

A character string that is unique to this step to identify it.
x

A step_outliers_maha object.

Value

An updated version of recipe with the new step added to the sequence of existing steps (if any), with the name on name_mutate and the probabilities calculated. For the tidy method, a tibble with columns index (the row indexes of the tibble) and outlier_probability (the probabilites).

Details

All columns in the data are sampled and returned by juice() and bake().

All columns used in this step must be numeric with no missing data.

When used in modeling, users should strongly consider using the option skip = TRUE so that this operation is not conducted outside of the training set.

Examples

library(recipes)

#> Loading required package: dplyr
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'recipes'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     step
library(tidy.outliers)
library(OutlierDetection)
 rec_obj <-
 recipe(mpg ~ ., data = mtcars) %>%
 step_outliers_maha(all_numeric(),-all_outcomes()) %>%
 prep(mtcars)

juice(rec_obj)
